clues.text: Jell-O makes gelatin & this other dessert that comes in butterscotch, vanilla & (of course) chocolate

A trademarked name, it's a ring-shaped cake baked in a tube pan that has fluted sides
Many camps insist that you (or, more likely, mom) do this to all your clothing, maybe with a laundry marker

The Zuni in America say "keshi"; a big hello in this capital of Japan would be "konnichi wa"
In ancient times in this country, you might greet your mummy with "ak em hotep"
"Marhaba" works as a greeting in this common language of northern Africa & the Mideast
In this Sioux language whose name is found in 2 state names, you'd greet friends with "hau koda"

clues.text: A basic portion the baker deals in

Solve equations like 3x(squared)-15=0 & you could be headed for a Frank Nelson Cole Prize in this branch of math

"America!  America!  God shed His Grace on thee/ And crown thy good with brotherhood  from sea to" this
"O beautiful for spacious skies, for amber waves of grain/ For purple mountain majesties, above"  these 3 words
"O beautiful for patriot dream, that sees beyond the years/ Thine alabaster cities gleam, undimmed by human" these
"America!  America!  God mend thine every flaw/ Confirm thy soul in self-control, thy liberty in" this
"America!  America!  May God thy gold refine/ till all success be nobleness, and every gain" this godly word

rounds.text: The 2 state capitals located on the Mississippi River
rounds.response: St. Paul, Minnesota & Baton Rouge, Louisiana
